definition: a mixture of lime or gypsum with sand and water, dress by covering with a therapeutic substance
details:
noun
- a mixture of lime or gypsum with sand and water
- any of several gypsum cements
= synonyms: plaster of Paris
- adhesive tape used in dressing wounds
= synonyms: adhesive plaster
- a surface of hardened plaster (as on a wall or ceiling)
= example: a surface of hardened plaster (as on a wall or ceiling)
= synonyms: plasterwork
- a medical dressing consisting of a soft heated mass of meal or clay that is spread on a cloth and applied to the skin to treat inflamed areas or improve circulation etc.
= synonyms: poultice, cataplasm
verb
- dress by covering with a therapeutic substance
= synonyms: poultice
- coat with plaster
= synonyms: daub
- apply a heavy coat to
= synonyms: stick on, plaster over
- apply a plaster cast to
= example: apply a plaster cast to
- affix conspicuously
= example: affix conspicuously
- cover conspicuously or thickly, as by pasting something on
= example: cover conspicuously or thickly, as by pasting something on
= synonyms: beplaster
